poem:
Title: Stir in Coalition Stratagem

In trees green, alliances built,
Chalmers, troubled with power,
Bank and Senate, a woven quilt. 

Veto cries echo the hour,
Review whispers though unseen
Dance in the legislative tower.

Seeds sprouting unforseen,
A cautious plan to scrap,
Suddenly caught in between. 

Two warring factions overlap,
In the stillness of political trap.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Greens-Coalition alliance may force Chalmers to keep power to overrule RBA on rates An alliance between the Greens and Liberal parties in the Senate could force Jim Chalmers to keep a government power that allows treasurers to overrule Reserve Bank decisions on interest rates. Chalmers announced plans to scrap the veto power in the government response to recommendations from a panel which reviewed the Reserve Bank operations and made suggestions for improvement.
